vars.name: SERVER_IP
vars.description: The IP address of the server where all services will be running. It wil typically be the IP address of your server in your local network/home network

vars.name: DOMAIN
vars.description: The following is the "rightmost" part of the URL to access the services. This must be a subdomain of a public domain you own. For example, if you own the domain "example.com", then you can use "home.example.com" as this domain.

sections.name: ADGUARD

vars.name: PASSWORD
vars.description: Password for the web interface. The username is "admin"

vars.name: CONF_PATH
vars.description: Path for AdGuard Home configuration files

vars.name: WORK_PATH
vars.description: Path for AdGuard Home working files

vars.name: CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN
vars.description: CloudFlare API token. You should create a new API token from CloudFlare Dashboard -> Profile -> API Tokens

vars.name: CLOUDFLARE_API_EMAIL
vars.description: CloudFlare API email. This is the email you used to log into CloudFlare to create the API token

vars.name: INGEST_PATH
vars.description: Path for ebooks to be ingested

vars.name: LIBRARY_PATH
vars.description: Path where the Calibre library is stored

vars.name: EXPORT_PATH

vars.name: UPLOAD_PATH
vars.description: Path for Immich data. This is where original photos and videos are stored

sections.name: IMMICH_DB
sections.description: SQL database for the Immich service

vars.name: USER
vars.description: SQL database user. Warning: DO NOT CHANGE, or there will be problems when restoring data

sections.name: IMMICH_ML

vars.name: CONTAINER_NAME
vars.description: The container's name. IMPORTANT: if this is NOT the default "immich-machine-learning", then this hostname has to be set in Immich's server settings via the web interface

sections.name: IMMICH_REDIS
sections.description: Redis database for the Immich service

sections.name: PORTAINER
sections.description: Service for managing Docker infrastructure. See https://github.com/portainer/portainer

vars.name: UPLOAD_PATH
vars.description: Path to upload files that Firefly can ingest

vars.name: APP_ENV
vars.description: You can leave this on "local". If you change it to production most console commands will ask for extra confirmation. Never set it to "testing".

vars.name: APP_DEBUG
vars.description: Set to true if you want to see debug information in error screens.

vars.name: SITE_OWNER
vars.description: This should be your email address. The variable is used in some errors shown to users who aren't admin.

vars.name: APP_KEY
vars.description: The encryption key for your sessions. Keep this very secure. Change it to a string of exactly 32 chars. Avoid the character #, it may break things

vars.name: DEFAULT_LANGUAGE
vars.description: Firefly III will launch using this language (for new users and unauthenticated visitors)

vars.name: DEFAULT_LOCALE
vars.description: The locale defines how numbers are formatted. By default this value is the same as whatever the language is.

vars.name: TRUSTED_PROXIES
vars.description: Useful variable when using Docker and/or a reverse proxy. Set it to ** and reverse proxies work just fine.

vars.name: LOG_CHANNEL
vars.description: The log channel defines where your log entries go to. Several options exist. You can use 'single' for one big fat error log (not recommended). Also available are 'syslog', 'errorlog' and 'stdout' which will log to the system itself. A rotating log option is 'daily', creates 5 files that (surprise) rotate. A cool option is 'papertrail' for cloud logging. Default setting 'stack' will log to 'daily' and to 'stdout' at the same time.

vars.name: LOG_LEVEL
vars.description: Log level. You can set this from least severe to most severe: debug, info, notice, warning, error, critical, alert, emergency. If you set it to debug your logs will grow large, and fast. If you set it to emergency probably nothing will get logged, ever.

vars.name: AUDIT_LOG_LEVEL
vars.description: Audit log level. The audit log is used to log notable Firefly III events on a separate channel. These log entries may contain sensitive financial information. The audit log is disabled by default. To enable it, set AUDIT_LOG_LEVEL to "info". To disable it, set AUDIT_LOG_LEVEL to "emergency"

vars.name: AUDIT_LOG_CHANNEL
vars.description: If you want, you can redirect the audit logs to another channel. Set 'audit_stdout', 'audit_syslog', 'audit_errorlog' to log to the system itself. Use audit_daily to log to a rotating file. Use audit_papertrail to log to papertrail. If you do this, the audit logs may be mixed with normal logs because the settings for these channels are often the same as the settings for the normal logs

vars.name: DB_CONNECTION
vars.description: The database connection to use. For other database types, see the FAQ: https://docs.firefly-iii.org/references/faq/install/#i-want-to-use-sqlite

vars.name: MYSQL_USE_SSL
vars.description: MySQL supports SSL. You can configure it here. (NOTE: several related environment variables omitted by me...)

vars.name: CACHE_DRIVER
vars.description: The cache driver. If you're looking for performance improvements, you could install memcached or redis. (NOTE: all Redis config variables are omitted by me...)

vars.name: COOKIE_PATH
vars.description: The cookie path. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings

vars.name: COOKIE_DOMAIN
vars.description: The cookie domain. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings

vars.name: COOKIE_SECURE
vars.description: The cookie secure flag. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings

vars.name: COOKIE_SAMESITE
vars.description: The cookie samesite flag. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings. Setting to "strict" may give you trouble logging in

vars.name: ENABLE_EXTERNAL_MAP
vars.description: Set this value to true if you want to set the location of certain things, like transactions. Since this involves an external service, it's optional and disabled by default. (NOTE: some other environment variables related to the map omitted by me...)

vars.name: ENABLE_EXCHANGE_RATES
vars.description: Enable or disable exchange rate conversion

vars.name: ENABLE_EXTERNAL_RATES
vars.description: Set this value to true if you want Firefly III to download currency exchange rates from the internet. These rates are hosted by the creator of Firefly III inside an Azure Storage Container. Not all currencies may be available. Rates may be wrong.

vars.name: AUTHENTICATION_GUARD
vars.description: Firefly III supports a few authentication methods, such as 'web' (default, uses built in DB) or 'remote_user_guard' (for Authelia etc). Read more about these settings in the documentation: https://docs.firefly-iii.org/how-to/firefly-iii/advanced/authentication/

vars.name: USE_RUNNING_BALANCE
vars.description: Disable or enable the running balance column data. Please disable this. It's a very experimental feature

vars.name: LAYOUT
vars.description: The v2 layout is very experimental. If it breaks you get to keep both parts. Be wary of data loss

vars.name: QUERY_PARSER_IMPLEMENTATION
vars.description: Which Query Parser implementation to use for the search engine and rules. 'new' is experimental, 'legacy' is the classic one

sections.name: FIREFLY_DB
sections.description: SQL database for the Firefly service

sections.name: BACKUP
sections.description: Variables for the backup scripts that use Restic with Backblaze B2. These variables do not correspond to any container

vars.name: RESTIC_REPOSITORY
vars.description: The repository to use for backups. Should be "b2:<bucket_id>:<directory_inside_bucket>/"

vars.name: B2_KEY_ID
vars.description: They keyID of the application key you should have created for the bucket

vars.name: B2_APPLICATION_KEY
vars.description: The applicationKey of the application key you should have created for the bucket

vars.name: RESTIC_PASSWORD
vars.description: The password to use for Restic. It is used to encrypt the backup files. DO KEEP A COPY OF THIS VARIABLE SOMEWHERE SAFE!

vars.name: PATH
vars.description: Path to save the backup files into. Please note, all data you want to backup will be copy-pasted into this folder. Make sure you have enough disk space

vars.name: RETENTION_DAYS
vars.description: How many days to keep the backup files. Backups older than this number of days will be purged
